result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Christopher Turner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant David Christopher Turner in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Defendant David Christopher Turner in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read in as to case 15cm1518.

Attorney Eric Richard Hart in court, defendant David Christopher Turner not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Eric Richard Hart in court, defendant David Christopher Turner not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-28-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant David Christopher Turner not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Defendant NOT produced.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Defense requests an adjourned Plea and Sentencing date. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant David Christopher Turner not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-26-2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MENARDS.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant David Christopher Turner in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant David Christopher Turner in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Defendant David Christopher Turner not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 5-21-2015. Defendant is in custody at HOC. Needs to be produced for court. Both files sent to case prep for OTP by Sheriff's department.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 05-21-2015 at 01:30pm
